p: Facile methods to reliably prepare complex materials facilitate new technologies and medicines. Towards the development of optoelectronic materials and sensors, predictable assemblies of hard nanomaterials have enabled emergent optical, electronic, and magnetic properties. 1– 4 For biomedical applications, the advantageous safety and clearance properties of soft organic materials have propelled liposomes, polymer micelles, hydrogels, and dendrimers into the research spotlight. 5– 10 Surprisingly, far less attention has been placed on incorporating chemical complexity into emulsions 11– 13 despite their simple formation and ability to encapsulate significant amounts of cargo. 14– 16
